messageBody:
Greg said:

>- If you are going to transfer control to the community, why
>not "Community Planning Game". That is, implement the XP Planning
>Game where the community is the customer. The community could
>express what they desire (stories) and set priorities.

Tha would be cool. The "tracker - feature request" @ sourceforge seems to be
a good place to put feature requests, alas there is no voting capability.

Also, Kent himself said here
(http://sourceforge.net/forum/forum.php?thread_id=112344&forum_id=48542)
that discussion of the next release should go @
http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?JunitNextRelease

>- Providing hooks for extensions would be great. Right now, the most
>frequently use hook is subclassing. Unfortunately this makes it
>difficult to use two extensions at once.

It think this is the way to go. Provide stable enough hook so that multiple
extensions won't clash with one another. Extending by subclassing leads to
troubles when, for example, you want to use a data driven extension thaty
says "just derive your test cases from ConfigurableTestCase" and at the same
time a servlet testing extension that says "Juste derive your test cases
from ServletTestCase".

By having a more flexible extension mechanism (like test result listeners
maybe...) the core junit could continue to be small and beautifull while
enabling other graviting package to integrate without junit code
modification and without clashing with other extensions.

just my 0.02$,
mathieu
